media:group.media:title: Rising bubbles float in water
media:group.media:description:
Bubbles are generated at the bottom of a water tank. They rise to the surface and form clusters. The clustering is known as the Cheerios effect for the similarity to breakfast cereals in milk. Simulation done with Aphros https://github.com/cselab/aphros
See article (https://arxiv.org/abs/2103.01513â€‹) for more applications and details.
Check out online demos:
- liquid drops and coalescence prevention https://cselab.github.io/aphros/wasm/hydro.html
- electrochemical reactor https://cselab.github.io/aphros/wasm/electrochem.html
